sentence.Network_cn: 他为自己从荒地上开辟出的花园而感到自豪。

sentence.Network_en: The wilderness campsite had its own peculiar enchantment.

sentence.Network_en: The Antarctic is the world's last great wilderness.
sentence.Network_cn: 南极洲是世界上最後一個大荒原。

jx.jx_en_mean: an unheeded advocate of reform (see Matt. 3:3 etc.)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无人理睬的改革主张（见《马太福音》3：3等）

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wildēornes 'land inhabited only by wild animals', from wild dēor 'wild deer' + -ness

entry.def: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people.

example.ex: He is proud of the garden he made from a wilderness.
example.tran: 他为自己从荒地上开辟出的花园而感到自豪。

entry.tran: 在野;不掌权；不活跃；坐冷板凳
entry.def: If politicians or other well-known people spend time in the wilderness, they are not in an influential position or very active in their profession for that time.

example.ex: ...a party released from 12 years in the wilderness...
example.tran: 摆脱了12年在野状态的政党

example.ex: For so long he had waited in the wilderness for a recall to Test cricket.
example.tran: 这么长时间以来，他一直在坐冷板凳，等着被召回参加板球对抗赛。

auth_sentence.content: Commercial feuds in the lawless depths of the wilderness.

auth_sentence.content: Yet they are braving the dangers of the wilderness.

auth_sentence.content: I am the voice in the wilderness hear me roar.

means.word_mean: (政治家)在野；不再当政(或掌权)

sentences.en: After a few years in the wilderness she was allowed to return to a job in the government.
sentences.cn: 被迫退出政坛几年之后她重新获得了一个政府的职务。
